de.thkoeln.bibl.api.rfid.reader

Class FrameReader<T extends BaseTag>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.rfid.reader.Reader<T>
      • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.rfid.reader.ThreadedReader<T>
        • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.rfid.reader.BRMReader<T>
          • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.rfid.reader.FrameReader<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of tags the reader can handle
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FrameWorkerListener<T>, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener

    public class FrameReader<T extends BaseTag>
extends BRMReader<T>
implements FrameWorkerListener<T>
    Class extends the BRMReader to maximize the scan precision. It's based on the BRMReader but adds a process to determine a more realistic scan order of the scanned tags. The FrameReader scans the tags in the buffered reader mode, checks the tag against a valid RSSI and adds its to a queue for post-processing by the FrameWorker. The post-processing is based on the RSSI, the size of the scan field of the reader and the speed the reader is moved over tags. With this information a virtual position correction can be done. For details @see FrameWorker.
    Author:
    Patrick Rogalla

      • FrameReader

        public FrameReader(java.lang.Class<T> tagClass,
                   ReaderConnection con,
                   int cacheSize,
                   int rssiLimit,
                   int scanSpeed,
                   int fieldSize)
            throws de.feig.FedmException
        Initialize new Frame Reader.
        Parameters:
        tagClass - the tag class the reader handles
        con - the connection used to communicate with the reader
        cacheSize - the initial cache size for storing tags
        rssiLimit - the limit RSSI a tag is processed
        scanSpeed - the reader moving speed in seconds per meter
        fieldSize - the reader detection field-size in centimeters
        Throws:
        de.feig.FedmException - if the BRM table could't initialized
